revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-20 18:38:45.000000000', 'message': "Remove six and python 2.7 full support

Six is in use to help us to keep support for python 2.7.
Since the ussuri cycle we decide to remove the python 2.7
support so we can go ahead and also remove six usage from
the python code.

Review process and help
-----------------------
Removing six introduce a lot of changes and an huge amount of modified files
To simplify reviews we decided to split changes into several patches to avoid
painful reviews and avoid mistakes.

To review this patch you can use the six documentation [1] to obtain help and
understand choices.

Additional informations
-----------------------
Changes related to 'six.b(data)' [2]
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

six.b [2] encode the given datas in latin-1 in python3 so I did the same
things in this patch.

Latin-1 is equal to iso-8859-1 [3].

This encoding is the default encoding [4] of certain descriptive HTTP
headers.

I suggest to keep latin-1 for the moment and to move to another encoding
in a follow-up patch if needed to move to most powerful encoding (utf8).

HTML4 support utf8 charset and utf8 is the default charset for HTML5 [5].

Note that this commit message is autogenerated and not necesserly contains
changes related to 'six.b'

[1] https://six.readthedocs.io/
[2] https://six.readthedocs.io/#six.b
[3] https://docs.python.org/3/library/codecs.html#standard-encodings
[4] https://www.w3schools.com/charsets/ref_html_8859.asp
[5] https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_charset.asp

Patch 12 of a serie of 28 patches

Change-Id: I2a60193d27a3496e96d383c1897b8665ad481efb

commit_message:
Remove six and python 2.7 full support

Six is in use to help us to keep support for python 2.7.
Since the ussuri cycle we decide to remove the python 2.7
support so we can go ahead and also remove six usage from
the python code.

Review process and help
-----------------------
Removing six introduce a lot of changes and an huge amount of modified files
To simplify reviews we decided to split changes into several patches to avoid
painful reviews and avoid mistakes.

To review this patch you can use the six documentation [1] to obtain help and
understand choices.

Additional informations
-----------------------
Changes related to 'six.b(data)' [2]
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

six.b [2] encode the given datas in latin-1 in python3 so I did the same
things in this patch.

Latin-1 is equal to iso-8859-1 [3].

This encoding is the default encoding [4] of certain descriptive HTTP
headers.

I suggest to keep latin-1 for the moment and to move to another encoding
in a follow-up patch if needed to move to most powerful encoding (utf8).

HTML4 support utf8 charset and utf8 is the default charset for HTML5 [5].

Note that this commit message is autogenerated and not necesserly contains
changes related to 'six.b'

[1] https://six.readthedocs.io/
[2] https://six.readthedocs.io/#six.b
[3] https://docs.python.org/3/library/codecs.html#standard-encodings
[4] https://www.w3schools.com/charsets/ref_html_8859.asp
[5] https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_charset.asp

Patch 12 of a serie of 28 patches

Change-Id: I2a60193d27a3496e96d383c1897b8665ad481efb

subject: Bump to puppet 6.14
messages:
[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-23 12:11:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-23 12:14:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-23 12:16:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-04-26 14:53:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm for this, we need to improve our Puppet 6 testing as well since we are leaving Puppet 5 support soon :)"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-26 15:55:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Workflow

Thanks Tobias for your feedback.

I'll remove WIP because I think we are ready to move this forward.

From CentOS perspective I think 6.14 is the best chose at the moment because RDO now provide that version.

I was looking for some information to decide the minor version for Ubuntu, but IIUC current 6.11 is not related to the distro package, so I think we can just bump up to the same latest version as CentOS."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-04-26 15:59:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-04-27 14:59:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

"}, {'created': '2019-11-21 11:01:04.000000000', 'message': "Remove six and python 2.7 full support

Six is in use to help us to keep support for python 2.7.
Since the ussuri cycle we decide to remove the python 2.7
support so we can go ahead and also remove six usage from
the python code.

Review process and help
-----------------------
Removing six introduce a lot of changes and an huge amount of modified files
To simplify reviews we decided to split changes into several patches to avoid
painful reviews and avoid mistakes.

To review this patch you can use the six documentation [1] to obtain help and
understand choices.

Additional informations
-----------------------
Changes related to 'six.b(data)' [2]
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

six.b [2] encode the given datas in latin-1 in python3 so I did the same
things in this patch.

Latin-1 is equal to iso-8859-1 [3].

This encoding is the default encoding [4] of certain descriptive HTTP
headers.

I suggest to keep latin-1 for the moment and to move to another encoding
in a follow-up patch if needed to move to most powerful encoding (utf8).

HTML4 support utf8 charset and utf8 is the default charset for HTML5 [5].

Note that this commit message is autogenerated and not necesserly contains
changes related to 'six.b'

commit_message:
Remove six and python 2.7 full support

Six is in use to help us to keep support for python 2.7.
Since the ussuri cycle we decide to remove the python 2.7
support so we can go ahead and also remove six usage from
the python code.

Review process and help
-----------------------
Removing six introduce a lot of changes and an huge amount of modified files
To simplify reviews we decided to split changes into several patches to avoid
painful reviews and avoid mistakes.

To review this patch you can use the six documentation [1] to obtain help and
understand choices.

Additional informations
-----------------------
Changes related to 'six.b(data)' [2]
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

six.b [2] encode the given datas in latin-1 in python3 so I did the same
things in this patch.

Latin-1 is equal to iso-8859-1 [3].

This encoding is the default encoding [4] of certain descriptive HTTP
headers.

I suggest to keep latin-1 for the moment and to move to another encoding
in a follow-up patch if needed to move to most powerful encoding (utf8).

HTML4 support utf8 charset and utf8 is the default charset for HTML5 [5].

Note that this commit message is autogenerated and not necesserly contains
changes related to 'six.b'

[1] https://six.readthedocs.io/
[2] https://six.readthedocs.io/#six.b
[3] https://docs.python.org/3/library/codecs.html#standard-encodings
[4] https://www.w3schools.com/charsets/ref_html_8859.asp
[5] https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_charset.asp

Patch 11 of a serie of 28 patches

Change-Id: I1d796ac4dbe29217ed87015cde21597dbcd4cf9b

messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-04-23 22:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/train.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-04-24 14:45:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nAlready merged to stable/train'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2020-04-27 15:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-23 22:14:50.000000000', 'message': "Implement 'selector-append' sass function

'selector-append' is used in xstatic-mdi [1] but it isn't supported by
the latest pyScss.
As a workaround we use 'append-selector' function from pyScss until
'selector-append' will be supported.

This patch also reverts Ia9e1e807591d4428f585177f521d4cb9d463b917
because we don't need it anymore.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/xstatic-mdi/src/tag/1.6.50.2/xstatic/pkg/mdi/data/scss/_functions.scss#L2

stable/train backport:
A release note on the known issue is now removed as it is fixed
by this commit. Instead, a note on the workaround by this commit
is added.

Change-Id: Ib8ca0fcfe339cb68d6a157a00cbc2d34854ef4c5
Closes-Bug: #1771559
(cherry picked from commit 74d76e900f28e88190a35bff921c56349077ca53)
(cherry picked from commit f26c88721614d1c25bcd26740b8fb20a7a97bd05)
"}]
commit_message:
Implement 'selector-append' sass function

'selector-append' is used in xstatic-mdi [1] but it isn't supported by
the latest pyScss.
As a workaround we use 'append-selector' function from pyScss until
'selector-append' will be supported.

This patch also reverts Ia9e1e807591d4428f585177f521d4cb9d463b917
because we don't need it anymore.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/xstatic-mdi/src/tag/1.6.50.2/xstatic/pkg/mdi/data/scss/_functions.scss#L2

stable/train backport:
A release note on the known issue is now removed as it is fixed
by this commit. Instead, a note on the workaround by this commit
is added.

Change-Id: Ib8ca0fcfe339cb68d6a157a00cbc2d34854ef4c5
Closes-Bug: #1771559
(cherry picked from commit 74d76e900f28e88190a35bff921c56349077ca53)
(cherry picked from commit f26c88721614d1c25bcd26740b8fb20a7a97bd05)

commit_message:
Restore default netboot boot option

We changed the default boot option to local but should be netboot
for this job.

Change-Id: Ica114f552e230b45172484686f61c3d3cc3a5db9

commit_message:
Do not set removed [service:worker]enabled

The [service:worker]enabled parameter was removed in Designate[1], so
we don't need to set the parameter.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 09:15:02.000000000', 'message': 'nova: Release 19.2.0

As with 20.2.0 on stable/train this stable/stein release also sees a
minor version bump due to the inclusion of API behavioural change
bugfixes (6e71909b0b) and new configurables (a96e7ab830).

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 19.1.0..HEAD
6e71909b0b Reject boot request for unsupported images
b3afe74833 Make RBD imagebackend flatten method idempotent
a96e7ab830 Add config option for neutron client retries
4de766006d Reset the cell cache for databaseaccess in Service
7df3d9fbb9 Use placement stable version for functional job
265fd4f6bd Unplug VIFs as part of cleanup of networks
ff21016543 Functional test for UnexpectedDeletingTaskStateError
e7cd8b49e2 nova-live-migration: Ensure subnode is fenced during evacuation testing
8f8667a8dd Lowercase ironic driver hash ring and ignore case in cache
373c4ffde2 nova-live-migration: Wait for n-cpu services to come up after configuring Ceph
763b7897f4 Fix intermittently failing regression case
85052c055f Fix os-keypairs pagination links
9030b8a56d Fix hypervisors paginted collection_name.
405a35587a Clean up allocation if unshelve fails due to neutron
f960d1751d Reproduce bug 1862633
4700b3658e libvirt: Ignore DiskNotFound during update_available_resource
f5bc2c7ae4 libvirt: Provide the backing file format when creating qcow2 disks
b874c409c1 Enhance service restart in functional env

Change-Id: I3b85ef00dea4ac288ef061d690dc6780210091ec
'}]
commit_message:
nova: Release 19.2.0

As with 20.2.0 on stable/train this stable/stein release also sees a
minor version bump due to the inclusion of API behavioural change
bugfixes (6e71909b0b) and new configurables (a96e7ab830).

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 19.1.0..HEAD
6e71909b0b Reject boot request for unsupported images
b3afe74833 Make RBD imagebackend flatten method idempotent
a96e7ab830 Add config option for neutron client retries
4de766006d Reset the cell cache for databaseaccess in Service
7df3d9fbb9 Use placement stable version for functional job
265fd4f6bd Unplug VIFs as part of cleanup of networks
ff21016543 Functional test for UnexpectedDeletingTaskStateError
e7cd8b49e2 nova-live-migration: Ensure subnode is fenced during evacuation testing
8f8667a8dd Lowercase ironic driver hash ring and ignore case in cache
373c4ffde2 nova-live-migration: Wait for n-cpu services to come up after configuring Ceph
763b7897f4 Fix intermittently failing regression case
85052c055f Fix os-keypairs pagination links
9030b8a56d Fix hypervisors paginted collection_name.
405a35587a Clean up allocation if unshelve fails due to neutron
f960d1751d Reproduce bug 1862633
4700b3658e libvirt: Ignore DiskNotFound during update_available_resource
f5bc2c7ae4 libvirt: Provide the backing file format when creating qcow2 disks
b874c409c1 Enhance service restart in functional env

Change-Id: I3b85ef00dea4ac288ef061d690dc6780210091ec

commit_message:
Add docs and release note for CentOS 8

Backport note: adapted for Train release which supports both CentOS 7
and 8.

Adds a support matrix page to documentation.

Change-Id: Ia783f7c42219617cde2accd3f1db013c9bda7679
Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8
(cherry picked from commit 8cf8ab4e549db532141d2c3d5bcff7f572b1470a)

> new var for tox constraint. It might break people setting the old
 > var for constraint but do we have way in tox to support both?

The old way is deprecated [1]. It seems highlight unlikely that anyone is overriding this and there's no way to handle both, unfortunately.

[1] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/raw/branch/master/roles/tox/README.rst"}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2020-04-24 14:12:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-04-24 14:25:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

> > new var for tox constraint. It might break people setting the old
 > > var for constraint but do we have way in tox to support both?
 > 
 > The old way is deprecated [1]. It seems highlight unlikely that
 > anyone is overriding this and there's no way to handle both,
 > unfortunately.
 > 
 > [1] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/raw/branch/master/roles/tox/README.rst

humm, Tempest tox is one example where those env var are set from various place and I am not sure how to migrate to new var. But nova is not that bad in that case but I was worried about any third party CI or scripts using the old var. 

anyways as there is no way to handle both let's go with this and change to new var in master also."}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-04-24 16:21:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-04-27 14:20:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2020-04-23 21:37:41.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie55b9cde6e3fcca4a6708dddc495018f327aef00
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie55b9cde6e3fcca4a6708dddc495018f327aef00

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-12 14:25:01.000000000', 'message': 'Change WSGI context from neutron_context to service_context

The pecan_wsgi code has a context that includes a "neutron_context".
This works fine until CADF auditing is turned on.  Once that happens,
the context is sent to keystonemiddleware for serialization, and it
fails because neutron_context is not a serializable object.

The Depends-On change adds an exclusion for "service_context" as a
non-Neutron-specific way of dealing with this problem.  This change
alters pecan_wsgi to use "service_context" instead of "neutron_context"
so that CADF auditing can work.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/508659/

commit_message:
Change WSGI context from neutron_context to service_context

The pecan_wsgi code has a context that includes a "neutron_context".
This works fine until CADF auditing is turned on.  Once that happens,
the context is sent to keystonemiddleware for serialization, and it
fails because neutron_context is not a serializable object.

The Depends-On change adds an exclusion for "service_context" as a
non-Neutron-specific way of dealing with this problem.  This change
alters pecan_wsgi to use "service_context" instead of "neutron_context"
so that CADF auditing can work.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/508659/
Change-Id: I79f91ed018c8f0ee9f78890db6cc11650d83bd38
Closes-Bug: #1720486

[{'created': '2020-04-25 21:08:19.000000000', 'message': 'Do not try to build skipped/unbuildable images

When build is done with logging to separate files we have a lot of files
with logs like this:

INFO:kolla.common.utils.mongodb:Skipping mongodb

This patch stops that. Builds will be a bit faster as we do not push
skipped or unbuildable images into build queue anymore.

Change-Id: Id8198451e77669d1472f3a21fd3a97f0e6e67cd8
(cherry picked from commit 0de8a57f9e5659f13db97bfe27ea5b0c7d452454)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not try to build skipped/unbuildable images

When build is done with logging to separate files we have a lot of files
with logs like this:

INFO:kolla.common.utils.mongodb:Skipping mongodb

This patch stops that. Builds will be a bit faster as we do not push
skipped or unbuildable images into build queue anymore.

Change-Id: Id8198451e77669d1472f3a21fd3a97f0e6e67cd8
(cherry picked from commit 0de8a57f9e5659f13db97bfe27ea5b0c7d452454)

commit_message:
Added new API test_create_sg_rules_when_quota_disabled

The test actually tries to create security group rules
while the quota is disable. The goal is to check that we
are not enforce SG rules quota while it disabled.

Change-Id: I504b98ecaa3346799b0a09ec93894472794d4635

subject: Use "pip -m install"
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-26 12:48:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-04-27 13:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-04-27 14:53:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-26 12:48:47.000000000', 'message': 'Use "pip -m install"

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value - after
adding constraints to deps as is best practice as well.

Mosts tests itself use "pip install" in the shell scripts which sets
also the constraints. Change that to "python -m pip install" like done
for tox.

Change-Id: I27f80d8aa4ac3688ee56e8a9234e34f4e09afe34
'}]
commit_message:
Use "pip -m install"

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value - after
adding constraints to deps as is best practice as well.

Mosts tests itself use "pip install" in the shell scripts which sets
also the constraints. Change that to "python -m pip install" like done
for tox.

Change-Id: I27f80d8aa4ac3688ee56e8a9234e34f4e09afe34

messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-27 11:03:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2020-04-27 13:07:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-27 13:28:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 11:03:26.000000000', 'message': 'Improve SSH known host error messages

A common failure early on when using Kayobe is during discovery of SSH
known hosts. This happens if a host does not have an IP address
configured on the admin (SSH) network. The failure looks like this:

PLAY [Ensure known hosts are configured]
**********************************************************************
TASK [ssh-known-host : Scan for SSH keys]
**********************************************************************
failed: [compute0 -> localhost] (item=) => {"ansible_loop_var": "item",
    "changed": false, "cmd": ["ssh-keyscan"], "delta": "0:00:00.013855",
    "end": "2020-04-17 10:51:01.857855", "item": "", "msg": "non-zero
        return code", "rc": 1, "start": "2020-04-17 10:51:01.844000",
    "stderr": "usage: ssh-keyscan [-46cDHv] [-f file] [-p port] [-T
        timeout] [-t type]\n\t\t   [host | addrlist namelist]",
    "stderr_lines": ["u sage: ssh-keyscan [-46cDHv] [-f file] [-p port]
        [-T timeout] [-t type]", "\t\t   [host | addrlist namelist]"],
        "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": []}

This happens when ansible_host is an empty string, typically because the
host has no IP address defined in for the admin network in
network-allocation.yml. This is very confusing for a new user. We should
provide a more informative message.

It's not exactly clear how a user gets to this point, since the
ip-allocation.yml playbook runs before ssh-known-host.yml, which should
populate network-allocation.yml.

This change detects this failure mode and provides a message with
information about how to resolve it.

Change-Id: I564b6e4509a30dec7c49a23bb2f75d490be775ed
Story: 2007566
Task: 39456
(cherry picked from commit 78909146279976000205bd608c817bbe8079ce30)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve SSH known host error messages

A common failure early on when using Kayobe is during discovery of SSH
known hosts. This happens if a host does not have an IP address
configured on the admin (SSH) network. The failure looks like this:

PLAY [Ensure known hosts are configured]
**********************************************************************
TASK [ssh-known-host : Scan for SSH keys]
**********************************************************************
failed: [compute0 -> localhost] (item=) => {"ansible_loop_var": "item",
    "changed": false, "cmd": ["ssh-keyscan"], "delta": "0:00:00.013855",
    "end": "2020-04-17 10:51:01.857855", "item": "", "msg": "non-zero
        return code", "rc": 1, "start": "2020-04-17 10:51:01.844000",
    "stderr": "usage: ssh-keyscan [-46cDHv] [-f file] [-p port] [-T
        timeout] [-t type]\n\t\t   [host | addrlist namelist]",
    "stderr_lines": ["u sage: ssh-keyscan [-46cDHv] [-f file] [-p port]
        [-T timeout] [-t type]", "\t\t   [host | addrlist namelist]"],
        "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": []}

This happens when ansible_host is an empty string, typically because the
host has no IP address defined in for the admin network in
network-allocation.yml. This is very confusing for a new user. We should
provide a more informative message.

It's not exactly clear how a user gets to this point, since the
ip-allocation.yml playbook runs before ssh-known-host.yml, which should
populate network-allocation.yml.

This change detects this failure mode and provides a message with
information about how to resolve it.

Change-Id: I564b6e4509a30dec7c49a23bb2f75d490be775ed
Story: 2007566
Task: 39456
(cherry picked from commit 78909146279976000205bd608c817bbe8079ce30)

[{'created': '2020-03-30 05:31:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add force_unmap config option to Spectrum Virtualize Family driver

In some scenarios, User can't delete volume once this volume has host mapping
at Spectrum Virtualize Family(SVF) storage side. By enabling this config
option in cinder.conf or volume type, user can delete volume which has host
mapping, SVF cinder driver will send rmvdisk with extra option parameters:
"-removehostmappings".

commit_message:
Delete volume with additional removehostmappings parameter

In some scenarios, User can't delete volume once this volume has host
mapping at Spectrum Virtualize Family storage side.For example: User
destory server instance without detaching disk. With this patch user
can delete this kind of volume directly with cinder driver instead of
deleting this volume manually with storage GUI/TUI. This parameter is
only available while storage code_level is newer than 7.7.0.0.

Change-Id: I8acfdb2110d81a4b3d91060ea2deed122b21b61b
Closes-bug: #1855719

commit_message:
Enable focal for the charm and add ussuri bundles

Note that this uses the force_deploy option to force juju to deploy on
focal prior to focal's official release.

Change-Id: Iac12a94de0656a14d32c16c814cb8810c5f7e0b7
Related-Bug: #1866645

commit_message:
aarch64/centos8: no fluentd, rabbitmq, kolla-toolbox

AArch64 lacks Erlang in CentOS 8 - we have to wait for 8.2 release to
get it. So no RabbitMQ for us.

And no Fluentd.

Change-Id: I266cdfa09efcba1c54efaa3c16ffe556808b3673

commit_message:
Don't use mistral directory as WORK_DIR for config-download

As part of mistral removal all config-downloaded playbooks
are run from tripleoclient. This changes the download location
to $HOME/config-download.

Documentation for default location will be changed along with
all doc changes for mistral removal.

Closes-Bug: #1874432
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/721568/
Change-Id: Ib4c9c47baabd64f008c4f61e4fa8c37a311350a3

subject: Bump default tox env from py37 to py38
messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-24 15:32:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-04-24 17:18:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-04-27 14:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 15:32:58.000000000', 'message': 'Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I4b2fe2b193afde8c2eaf4e704ba21231fab93361
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I4b2fe2b193afde8c2eaf4e704ba21231fab93361
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: [WIP] Better isolation by default
messages:
[{'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-19 08:58:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-19 11:56:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

hmm, this is weird; how come it passes on c8 here'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-19 11:58:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Requirement already satisfied: docker>=2.4.2 in /usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages (4.2.0)

so c8 infra images come preinstalled with this via system-wide pip?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-20 10:03:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Don't usually review DNMs but the name intrigued me"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-20 12:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

yeah, C8 image has a lot of packages pip-installed system-wide here, I do wonder why but did not have time to check yet'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-23 19:04:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

after intensive session on #opendev with clarkb and fungi, it has been established that:
1) jmespath really is in the images
2) docker gets pulled in by requirements.txt
3) the path for custom-installed system-wide pip packages is different between centos and ubu/deb, hence the difference in behaviour - this also affects what virtualenv inheriting system packages sees, it seems custom location is *not* included (hence things fail on python docker package being missing here ubu/deb)'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-24 08:18:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

23:47:08 <ianw> clarkb yoctozepto: centos-8 is slightly different in that it only has packaged pip installed -- we do not overwrite it with pip installed versions'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-26 10:26:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-26 10:35:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-26 14:26:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-26 15:09:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-26 17:05:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-26 17:43:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-26 19:11:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

probably best as a separate variable?
and switch to modern venv?
WDYT?'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-26 19:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

upgrades are faulty due to the way we do bootstrap (singlenode get global docker module due to requirements.txt from Train, multinode lack it on secondaries because it got installed in the virtualenv)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-27 10:09:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

Spent quite a lot of time trying to get this right in kayobe. I think we use group_vars/{seed,overcloud} to set this for kayobe playbooks, and for kolla-ansible it goes in the inventory for the seed and overcloud groups. There are a few bootstrapping tasks where it gets overridden because the venv doesn't exist yet."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-27 15:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle except
swift and sorlets which is exception approved in this goal.

Somehow this repo is left to remove the support of py2.7.

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ic9eaaca9981aec50ef1f235d69a03ad2698e36fe

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie7b6bb6375f134fe2018c5891dc67121e3869009

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5f8a5f7614110f48f8298bff5cba35800ffaae8d

'}, {'created': '2020-04-20 16:32:14.000000000', 'message': "Remove policy.json from charm for ussuri

Glance (in ussuri) uses policy-in-code, and so that policy.json file
doesn't ship with the package.  This means that the charm can't rely on
the file existing ussuri onwards.  This patchset changes the way the
charm uses policy.json by switching it to a charm determined policy.yaml
file (preferred format) with the only 3 options that the charm
determines to enforce.

Also add yaml vars to focal-ussuri bundle

This brings it into line with the other charms that are part of the the
enable-focal topic.  This makes it easier to add a new bundle just by
changing a couple of variables.

Closes-Bug: #1872996
Change-Id: I47f19272a4e0af3781843608b76304ce8ba1e2b8

commit_message:
Remove policy.json from charm for ussuri

Glance (in ussuri) uses policy-in-code, and so that policy.json file
doesn't ship with the package.  This means that the charm can't rely on
the file existing ussuri onwards.  This patchset changes the way the
charm uses policy.json by switching it to a charm determined policy.yaml
file (preferred format) with the only 3 options that the charm
determines to enforce.

Also add yaml vars to focal-ussuri bundle

This brings it into line with the other charms that are part of the the
enable-focal topic.  This makes it easier to add a new bundle just by
changing a couple of variables.

Closes-Bug: #1872996
Change-Id: I47f19272a4e0af3781843608b76304ce8ba1e2b8

commit_message:
Enable focal and ussuri testing for gate

This adds bundles for:

 * bionic-ussuri-pacemaker-remote-ssl
 * focal-ussuri-pacemaker-remove-ssl

And adds a force option of the focal-ussuri* bundle as it is not yet
officially supported by Juju.

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/251
Change-Id: I37e1e30653c81eec76bc78a68533dbf91a9557d9

commit_message:
Release ironic-tempest-plugin for ussuri

This is the cycle-automatic release for ironic-tempest-plugin.
Please +1 if this is ready to go, or -1 if the team needs
a little more time. If so, please update with the new commit
hash to use when ready.

If no response, this will be approved soon after the April
23rd deadline.

Change-Id: I03b28b47f0c89f647d32143db20b8fec8d11c7e2
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Supported window is ironic-1,ironic,ironic+1 which means ocata is outside of the support window. :\'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-27 13:27:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-27 13:28:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-20 04:01:47.000000000', 'message': 'Remove hardcoded reference to cinder LVM loopback device

Replace hardcoded reference to "/dev/loop2" by allowing losetup to
dynamically choose the next available loopback device number.

Eliminate hiera data that set cinder_lvm_loop_device_size. This is not
needed because the associated file is created by a host prep task, and
the puppet code will be removed by https://review.opendev.org/720139.

Closes-Bug: #1872881
Change-Id: Ia0302d1d55dcb8333d7db9713822075d32cd852a
(cherry picked from commit 502947b4beed6bc7f3f7f58706b1934766561c0e)
Conflicts:
	deployment/cinder/cinder-common-container-puppet.yaml
'}]
commit_message:
Remove hardcoded reference to cinder LVM loopback device

Replace hardcoded reference to "/dev/loop2" by allowing losetup to
dynamically choose the next available loopback device number.

Eliminate hiera data that set cinder_lvm_loop_device_size. This is not
needed because the associated file is created by a host prep task, and
the puppet code will be removed by https://review.opendev.org/720139.

Closes-Bug: #1872881
Change-Id: Ia0302d1d55dcb8333d7db9713822075d32cd852a
(cherry picked from commit 502947b4beed6bc7f3f7f58706b1934766561c0e)
Conflicts:
	deployment/cinder/cinder-common-container-puppet.yaml

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.

Change-Id: I601d900d4c34565e08d121f4100ebd3b1140b991

[{'created': '2020-04-27 13:24:00.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate from ujson to simplejson

The change updates the imports to use simplejson library and fixes three
unit tests. In particular TestUtils.test_parse_alarm_state_hist_message
has been slightly changed to make testing more robust.

Also, Python 2 specific implemetation has been removed from
influxdb.line_utils .

Additionally, standard library unittest.mock is used instead of the
third party mock lib.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/718014

Change-Id: I64b1a60e8be929c25c005a0f429b1274cb8570e6
Story: 2007549
Task: 39390
(cherry picked from commit dc8956d7b83d2346056371d0b2224693366a9b7a)
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate from ujson to simplejson

The change updates the imports to use simplejson library and fixes three
unit tests. In particular TestUtils.test_parse_alarm_state_hist_message
has been slightly changed to make testing more robust.

Also, Python 2 specific implemetation has been removed from
influxdb.line_utils .

Additionally, standard library unittest.mock is used instead of the
third party mock lib.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/718014
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/720188
Change-Id: I64b1a60e8be929c25c005a0f429b1274cb8570e6
Story: 2007549
Task: 39390
(cherry picked from commit dc8956d7b83d2346056371d0b2224693366a9b7a)

commit_message:
Fix haproxy restarting twice per Ansible run

Since haproxy is orchestrated via site.yml in a single play,
it does not need flushing handlers as handlers run will
happen at the end of this play.

Change-Id: Ia3743575da707325be93c39b4a2bcae9211cacb2
Related-Bug: #1864810
Closes-Bug: #1875228

commit_message:
Remove "warning: previous definition of" warnings

Newer puppet explicitely warn about constant redefinitions like:
Apr 23 18:08:30 puppet-user: /etc/puppet/modules/pacemaker/lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_common.rb:10: warning: already initialized constant PCMK_TMP_BASE'
Apr 23 18:08:30 puppet-user: /usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules/pacemaker/lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_common.rb:10: warning: previous definition of PCMK_TMP_BASE was here'

Let's fix those and simplify the code a bit

Change-Id: I915f280eb5435a61d0d7b1988e94cd87e7ac7922

commit_message:
[octavia] Adds region_name if enable_barbican

Adds necessary "region_name" to octavia.conf when
"enable_barbican" is set to "true".

Closes-Bug: #1867926

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-16 14:35:30.000000000', 'message': "Run kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers as kolla user

Previously, Kayobe used Kolla Ansible's bootstrap-servers command to
create a user account and Python virtual environment for Kolla Ansible.
In order to do this it used the Kayobe Ansible user and Python
interpreter.

This causes problems for Ansible fact caching, which needs separate
caches for Kayobe and Kolla Ansible, since the different users and
Python interpreters used result in different facts. Bootstrapping
servers with the Kayobe user and interpreter resulted in the Kolla
Ansible fact cache being populated with Kayobe's user and interpreter.

This change disables user creation during Kolla Ansible's
bootstrap-servers command, instead creating the user and virtual
environment in Kayobe prior to running the command. This allows the
bootstrap-servers command to be executed using the normal Kolla Ansible
user and interpreter, which results in the correct facts being gathered.

The downside here is some duplication of code and configuration, but a
nice side effect is that we no longer need to dump configuration in the
CLI for host configure in order to fetch the Ansible user and
interpreter.

Change-Id: I85670be7242bc436f73c689f027670b0938ba031
Story: 2007492
Task: 39444
"}, {'created': '2020-04-16 15:31:37.000000000', 'message': "Run kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers as kolla user

The downside here is some duplication of code and configuration, but a
nice side effect is that we no longer need to dump configuration in the
CLI for host configure in order to fetch the Ansible user and
interpreter.

Change-Id: I85670be7242bc436f73c689f027670b0938ba031
Story: 2007492
Task: 39444
"}, {'created': '2020-04-16 19:44:48.000000000', 'message': "Run kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers as kolla user

commit_message:
Run kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers as kolla user

Previously, Kayobe used Kolla Ansible's bootstrap-servers command to
create a user account and Python virtual environment for Kolla Ansible.
In order to do this it used the Kayobe Ansible user and Python
interpreter.

This causes problems for Ansible fact caching, which needs separate
caches for Kayobe and Kolla Ansible, since the different users and
Python interpreters used result in different facts. Bootstrapping
servers with the Kayobe user and interpreter resulted in the Kolla
Ansible fact cache being populated with Kayobe's user and interpreter.

This change disables user creation during Kolla Ansible's
bootstrap-servers command, instead creating the user and virtual
environment in Kayobe prior to running the command. This allows the
bootstrap-servers command to be executed using the normal Kolla Ansible
user and interpreter, which results in the correct facts being gathered.

The downside here is some duplication of code and configuration, but a
nice side effect is that we no longer need to dump configuration in the
CLI for host configure in order to fetch the Ansible user and
interpreter.

Change-Id: I85670be7242bc436f73c689f027670b0938ba031
Story: 2007492
Task: 39444

commit_message:
Switch to uwsgi in grenade jobs

As we want to switch Neutron's default deployment method in Devstack
to be uwsgi, we need also to switch it in grenade jobs for both old and
new version. Otherwise, grenade jobs are failing as they can't update
from non-wsgi to wsgi deployment.

Change-Id: Ic981bd1c8ad1ebfa0db5d88befc554425460c34a

commit_message:
Add grenade-multinode-py3 job

With Zuul v3, rather than depending on the artifacts from the neutron
team, it makes sense to centralize generic Grenade jobs into the grenade
repo.  This provides a basic multinode job which can be used by the
following repos: devstack. neutron, nova, requirements, tempest, and the
grenade repo itself.

This is based on existing grenade-py3 job, with DVR configuration
overridable

For grenade gating, use this job for multinode, keeping neutron-grenade
on python2

Co-Authored-By: Nate Johnston <nate.johnston@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ibc4d516087c1ae6736890c18bd1a8b86972d8e59

commit_message:
Add Ussuri index pages

This change prepares Ussuri release and adds the index pages, it still
keeps Train as current release.

Disable ussuri projects that have not published yet.

Change-Id: I2b8a59ecb777ded5749f8a257bf902e729a72d11

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine

Change-Id: I4b40d9570a2214f245d439693daecced49f97dc5

commit_message:
bindep: we do not need compiler

Kolla project relies on container images where we control environment.
Host does not need compiler or development headers to install Kolla.

Change-Id: I71db51d167e1090b821be350571c279473e43329

[{'created': '2020-04-27 07:38:56.000000000', 'message': 'Implements: Reactive HUAWEI ibmc driver

The ibmc driver has been deprecated due to a lack of a functioning
third party CI. And now HUAWEI ironic 3rd party CI is back, we can
reactive the ibmc driver again.

Change-Id: I136aba37d8f5b2044e9c0f28498eb75b2d6499c9
Story: 2007594
Task: 39559
Signed-off-by: Qianbiao.NG <iampurse@vip.qq.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Implements: Reactive HUAWEI ibmc driver

The ibmc driver has been deprecated due to a lack of a functioning
third party CI. And now HUAWEI ironic 3rd party CI is back, we can
reactive the ibmc driver again.

Change-Id: I136aba37d8f5b2044e9c0f28498eb75b2d6499c9
Story: 2007594
Task: 39559
Signed-off-by: Qianbiao.NG <iampurse@vip.qq.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Removes and/or replaces all mentions of py27.

Cleans up obsolete requirements and their lower-constraints.

Separates test-requirements.

Makes lower-constraints pass outside of CI (MarkupSafe).

Adds FIXMEs about some hacky Mocks that may misbehave.

Change-Id: Ifc090bf3c1db17d8542ee591c91e8225a597bfe2

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local

commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I4fb7044f75d9b5947fa2a5e0955cb5240936b7b7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Migrate from ujson to simplejson

The change updates the imports to use simplejson library and fixes three
unit tests. In particular TestUtils.test_parse_alarm_state_hist_message
has been slightly changed to make testing more robust.

Also, Python 2 specific implemetation has been removed from
influxdb.line_utils .

Additionally, standard library unittest.mock is used instead of the
third party mock lib.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/718014
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/720188
Change-Id: I64b1a60e8be929c25c005a0f429b1274cb8570e6
Story: 2007549
Task: 39390

commit_message:
Make neutron ml2/ansible's base plugin variable

The ML2/ansible support is intended to be an "add on" to the base
Neutron plugin. This patch allows it to use the value set in the
resource registry as the base plugin so it should work with either
ML2/OVS or ML2/OVN.

Change-Id: I95f03ce7cec96640e4779f2a6a67585c9f152359

commit_message:
workbooks/access: allow to pass max_fail_percentage to playbooks

Some playbooks are called in this workbook, make sure we pass
max_fail_percentage.

subject: Wire max_fail_percentage for all playbooks
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-18 15:12:23.000000000', 'message': "Wire max_fail_percentage for all playbooks

- Change max_fail_percentage default to be 0, for backward
  compatibility. Which means that by default, no failure is tolerated.

- Wire max_fail_percentage in all the playbooks defined in
  common/deploy-steps.j2.
  Note: only Barbican seems to write their own playbook to deploy TSM,
  this won't be wired to it yet since it doesn't use the regular
  config-download inventory.

Change-Id: I37e65c581a18651db9c63a464359db5cd12723c5
"}]
commit_message:
Wire max_fail_percentage for all playbooks

- Change max_fail_percentage default to be 0, for backward
  compatibility. Which means that by default, no failure is tolerated.

- Wire max_fail_percentage in all the playbooks defined in
  common/deploy-steps.j2.
  Note: only Barbican seems to write their own playbook to deploy TSM,
  this won't be wired to it yet since it doesn't use the regular
  config-download inventory.

Change-Id: I37e65c581a18651db9c63a464359db5cd12723c5

commit_message:
Use upper constraints when installing Tenks

Backport: train, stein, rocky

This fixes issues seen with a-universe-from-nothing using stable/train.

Change-Id: Ib477de5f3af2e4c182d0c2999c274dbb5553531c
Story: 2007572
Task: 39469
(cherry picked from commit 27779992b196201518da4cb220a0d29bb56cf307)

commit_message:
Add py38 package metadata

Now that we are running the Victoria tests that include a
voting py38, we can now add the Python 3.8 metadata to the
package information to reflect that support.

Change-Id: I5bf6afb3bdddda1cdc5a2c0476ee15073a4d28da
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Pick up security group RPC API changes
messages: [{'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2020-04-27 06:57:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2020-04-27 12:16:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2020-04-27 06:57:06.000000000', 'message': 'Pick up security group RPC API changes

The MAC address is now included with along with security group
member IPs, as per this change [1].

We have to update the networking-hyperv sg driver, which currently
an IP string instead of a tuple.

[1] I2e3aa7c400d7bb17cc117b65faaa160b41013dde

Change-Id: I35a6318ed31e02c1986d65860cc0ddb9d744de8d
(cherry picked from commit 11be493f4458e695f5a5e4c8db833c3206cf4b44)
'}]
commit_message:
Pick up security group RPC API changes

The MAC address is now included with along with security group
member IPs, as per this change [1].

We have to update the networking-hyperv sg driver, which currently
an IP string instead of a tuple.

[1] I2e3aa7c400d7bb17cc117b65faaa160b41013dde

commit_message:
New resource OS::Neutron::QoSMinimumBandwidthRule

The 'minimum_bandwidth_rule' QoS rule type of Neutron (supported in both
egress and ingress directions since the Stein release) did not have a
Heat resource yet. This change adds it.

Change-Id: I693fe2f7801f78f827ef1c74e5874018cd9cf51b

commit_message:
Add py38 package metadata

Now that we are running the Victoria tests that include a
voting py38, we can now add the Python 3.8 metadata to the
package information to reflect that support.

Change-Id: Ibe733cb482501544644133fed494f672ef566b7a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-20 18:38:45.000000000', 'message': "Remove six and python 2.7 full support

Six is in use to help us to keep support for python 2.7.
Since the ussuri cycle we decide to remove the python 2.7
support so we can go ahead and also remove six usage from
the python code.

Review process and help
-----------------------
Removing six introduce a lot of changes and an huge amount of modified files
To simplify reviews we decided to split changes into several patches to avoid
painful reviews and avoid mistakes.

To review this patch you can use the six documentation [1] to obtain help and
understand choices.

Additional informations
-----------------------
Changes related to 'six.b(data)' [2]
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

six.b [2] encode the given datas in latin-1 in python3 so I did the same
things in this patch.

Latin-1 is equal to iso-8859-1 [3].

This encoding is the default encoding [4] of certain descriptive HTTP
headers.

I suggest to keep latin-1 for the moment and to move to another encoding
in a follow-up patch if needed to move to most powerful encoding (utf8).

HTML4 support utf8 charset and utf8 is the default charset for HTML5 [5].

Note that this commit message is autogenerated and not necesserly contains
changes related to 'six.b'

[1] https://six.readthedocs.io/
[2] https://six.readthedocs.io/#six.b
[3] https://docs.python.org/3/library/codecs.html#standard-encodings
[4] https://www.w3schools.com/charsets/ref_html_8859.asp
[5] https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_charset.asp

Patch 10 of a serie of 28 patches

Change-Id: Ic745ceced9989497c489f3df3ee9ff84fe507b88

commit_message:
Remove six and python 2.7 full support

Six is in use to help us to keep support for python 2.7.
Since the ussuri cycle we decide to remove the python 2.7
support so we can go ahead and also remove six usage from
the python code.

Review process and help
-----------------------
Removing six introduce a lot of changes and an huge amount of modified files
To simplify reviews we decided to split changes into several patches to avoid
painful reviews and avoid mistakes.

To review this patch you can use the six documentation [1] to obtain help and
understand choices.

Additional informations
-----------------------
Changes related to 'six.b(data)' [2]
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

six.b [2] encode the given datas in latin-1 in python3 so I did the same
things in this patch.

Latin-1 is equal to iso-8859-1 [3].

This encoding is the default encoding [4] of certain descriptive HTTP
headers.

I suggest to keep latin-1 for the moment and to move to another encoding
in a follow-up patch if needed to move to most powerful encoding (utf8).

HTML4 support utf8 charset and utf8 is the default charset for HTML5 [5].

Note that this commit message is autogenerated and not necesserly contains
changes related to 'six.b'

[1] https://six.readthedocs.io/
[2] https://six.readthedocs.io/#six.b
[3] https://docs.python.org/3/library/codecs.html#standard-encodings
[4] https://www.w3schools.com/charsets/ref_html_8859.asp
[5] https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_charset.asp

Patch 10 of a serie of 28 patches

Change-Id: Ic745ceced9989497c489f3df3ee9ff84fe507b88

commit_message:
Support custom Ansible configuration

Tuning Ansible is typically done by customising configuration in
ansible.cfg. Currently Kayobe adheres to the standard locations for
Ansible configuration [1].

This change allows custom Ansible configuration files stored in the
kayobe-config repository to be used for execution of Kayobe and Kolla
Ansible playbooks.

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/reference_appendices/config.html#ansible-configuration-settings-locations

Change-Id: Iab2021b8e88b5a3a2b0f8583f1246ab2c83670e5
Story: 2007494
Task: 39219

commit_message:
[skydive] fix: Use Keystone backend to authenticate API users

Update Skydive Analyzer's configuration to use Keystone as its backend
for authenticating users.  Any user with a role in the project defined
by the variable skydive_admin_tenant_name will be able to access
Skydive.

Change-Id: I64c811d5eb72c7406fd52b649fa00edaf2d0c07b
Closes-Bug: 1870903
(cherry picked from commit 7e5aa637283b32eaceaf0495794626a1fdeecd82)

commit_message:
[skydive] fix: Use Keystone backend to authenticate API users

Update Skydive Analyzer's configuration to use Keystone as its backend
for authenticating users.  Any user with a role in the project defined
by the variable skydive_admin_tenant_name will be able to access
Skydive.

Change-Id: I64c811d5eb72c7406fd52b649fa00edaf2d0c07b
Closes-Bug: 1870903
(cherry picked from commit 7e5aa637283b32eaceaf0495794626a1fdeecd82)

'}, {'created': '2020-04-27 06:54:57.000000000', 'message': "Add a Rally scenario for a very big mistral workflow

* This workflow used to be very slow (hours) before the certain
  performance improvements we've made over the last few months.
  Now with this patch it takes about 26 minutes on the CI
  infrastructure. Having this scenario will allow us to notice
  performance regressions timely when(if) they happen.
* Made several configuration changes to make this scenario work.
  The most important ones are:
   - Setting 'oslo_rpc_executor' to 'threading'. By default, it
     was 'eventlet' and there are known issues leading to deadlocks
     in Python threads (eventlet green threads don't get along with
     MySQL some drivers) if this value is set.
   - Disabling input and output data conversion for YAQL engine.
     This speeds it up drastically.

Change-Id: I0db62a3e68c8954d7db948769d79fc1649d34e31
Signed-off-by: ali <ali.abdelal@nokia.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add a Rally scenario for a very big mistral workflow

* This workflow used to be very slow (hours) before the certain
  performance improvements we've made over the last few months.
  Now with this patch it takes about 26 minutes on the CI
  infrastructure. Having this scenario will allow us to notice
  performance regressions timely when(if) they happen.
* Made several configuration changes to make this scenario work.
  The most important ones are:
   - Setting 'oslo_rpc_executor' to 'threading'. By default, it
     was 'eventlet' and there are known issues leading to deadlocks
     in Python threads (eventlet green threads don't get along with
     MySQL some drivers) if this value is set.
   - Disabling input and output data conversion for YAQL engine.
     This speeds it up drastically.

Change-Id: I0db62a3e68c8954d7db948769d79fc1649d34e31
Signed-off-by: ali <ali.abdelal@nokia.com>

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit 49d58bb81e097ef87f5ae525620695242ee9f312'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-20 23:57:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix padding logic for UDP health daemon

Should have done "pad to 8 characters" on the hex conversion, but it was
instead hardcoded to pad a single `0`, which is right in a lot of cases
but not all.

For example:
>>> ip1 = ipaddress.ip_address('98.136.140.23')
>>> ip2 = ipaddress.ip_address('10.1.1.1')
>>> "%X" % ip1._ip
'62888C17'
>>> "%X" % ip2._ip
'A010101'

Change-Id: Ia9fec4e72c00f7086489b245d9dc50ed9c27f12a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix padding logic for UDP health daemon

Should have done "pad to 8 characters" on the hex conversion, but it was
instead hardcoded to pad a single `0`, which is right in a lot of cases
but not all.

For example:
>>> ip1 = ipaddress.ip_address('98.136.140.23')
>>> ip2 = ipaddress.ip_address('10.1.1.1')
>>> "%X" % ip1._ip
'62888C17'
>>> "%X" % ip2._ip
'A010101'

Change-Id: Ia9fec4e72c00f7086489b245d9dc50ed9c27f12a

commit_message:
Correct delay between UDP healthchecks

Template was using timeout value instead of delay value.
Also clean up redundant values in the templates (things like retry and
delay_before_retry only need to be specified once at the top level).

Change-Id: I376917e40eb7a92f7f03e691ed9a0c23fd2ce8f8

[{'created': '2020-04-14 11:29:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix py3 amphora-agent cert-rotation type bug

Flask's stream always returns bytes, file write always takes string.
This causes py3 amps to return 500 on cert rotation AND wipe out the
certificate, so the amphora are no longer controllable and go to ERROR
state. Anyone running py3 amps prior to this patch will experience
amphorae breaking on a timer due to housekeeping cert rotation!

Change-Id: I831b0b48d719397c14d80f8ebcbad997c50c7795

This causes py3 amps to return 500 on cert rotation AND wipe out the

commit_message:
Fix py3 amphora-agent cert-rotation type bug

Flask's stream always returns bytes, file write always takes string.
This causes py3 amps to return 500 on cert rotation AND wipe out the
certificate, so the amphora are no longer controllable and go to ERROR
state. Anyone running py3 amps prior to this patch will experience
amphorae breaking on a timer due to housekeeping cert rotation!

Change-Id: I831b0b48d719397c14d80f8ebcbad997c50c7795

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 15:29:24.000000000', 'message': 'Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I4c60a7474da79da30122327ef3a6d8e87ccc4371
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I4c60a7474da79da30122327ef3a6d8e87ccc4371
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-20 12:50:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix test_multicast_between_vms_on_same_network

The test_multicast_between_vms_on_same_network had a few errors, one
related to the "mcast_address" being an IPAddress object and not a
string. This has been fixed by converting the object to its string
representation before trying to do a startswith() operation on it.

The second problem was related to the execution of the
unregistered_traffic_receiver.sh script. The script was created by
the default SSH user in its home directory but, when SSH'ing the VM to
execute it we had the become_root parameter set to True, which caused
the command to look for the script in the /root directory. This has been
fixed by creating and executing the script from the /tmp directory cos
it's userless.

This test also takes a while to run since it requires at least 3 VMs,
therefore this patch also marks it as "slow".

Change-Id: I4046aaf0e7f4171e6ce5751b79b84c943ccf56cd
Closes-Bug: #1873798
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-04-20 12:56:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix test_multicast_between_vms_on_same_network

commit_message:
Fix test_multicast_between_vms_on_same_network

The test_multicast_between_vms_on_same_network had a few errors, one
related to the "mcast_address" being an IPAddress object and not a
string. This has been fixed by converting the object to its string
representation before trying to do a startswith() operation on it.

The second problem was related to the execution of the
unregistered_traffic_receiver.sh script. The script was created by
the default SSH user in its home directory but, when SSH'ing the VM to
execute it we had the become_root parameter set to True, which caused
the command to look for the script in the /root directory. This has been
fixed by creating and executing the script from the /tmp directory cos
it's userless.

Change-Id: I4046aaf0e7f4171e6ce5751b79b84c943ccf56cd
Closes-Bug: #1873798
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-08 13:29:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix: failed to create snapshot with DriverFilter

Previously, while creating snapshots, the code didn't pass through
scheduler therefore available capacity for backend wasn't checked.
This was supported by [1] which passed a RequestSpec object to
scheduler with snapshot and volume properties (the same RequestSpec
object is used for volumes).
But when the scheduler tries to get volume_type from RequestSpec obj,
unfortunately, it has a property named 'volume_type' but is None for
snapshots which breaks the scheduler when getting extra_specs from
the volume type (as the default value {} would've been set if the
property didn't exist).

Similar issue occurred when we supported untyped volumes and was
fixed by [2] and [3].

This patch sets the volume_type to an empty dict when it is found
None (which is the case while creating snapshots).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/509011/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/457431/
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/471672/

Change-Id: I89a8cc42ca8984ee837a2b88f60ad126783282b9
Closes-Bug: #1856126
(cherry picked from commit 1e6707212244440c35881dafcea435d4f134124e)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix: failed to create snapshot with DriverFilter

Previously, while creating snapshots, the code didn't pass through
scheduler therefore available capacity for backend wasn't checked.
This was supported by [1] which passed a RequestSpec object to
scheduler with snapshot and volume properties (the same RequestSpec
object is used for volumes).
But when the scheduler tries to get volume_type from RequestSpec obj,
unfortunately, it has a property named 'volume_type' but is None for
snapshots which breaks the scheduler when getting extra_specs from
the volume type (as the default value {} would've been set if the
property didn't exist).

Similar issue occurred when we supported untyped volumes and was
fixed by [2] and [3].

This patch sets the volume_type to an empty dict when it is found
None (which is the case while creating snapshots).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/509011/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/457431/
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/471672/

Change-Id: I89a8cc42ca8984ee837a2b88f60ad126783282b9
Closes-Bug: #1856126
(cherry picked from commit 1e6707212244440c35881dafcea435d4f134124e)

commit_message:
Upgrade flake8-import-order version to 0.17.1

Full py3 compatible version.
Add all Python3 modules to stdlib list.
Also includes fix to an enum34 dependency bug.

Change-Id: I6163317368ed9281ad600f47aaa64cbcf44d9a13

commit_message:
Add mariadb_clustercheck image

Add mariadb_clustercheck image with xinetd and clustercheck binary for haproxy
checking of galera status.
Reorganise existing mariadb images by creating mariadb-base and mariadb-server.

Existing mariadb image will be deprecated (in a separate change).

Change-Id: Ib601f64e1514521154beeaac40f0c058a7119408

commit_message:
Fix issue where server fails to reboot

The iDRAC will return a "The command failed to set RequestedState" error
if the server is powered off and a reboot is requested.  In this
situation, convert the requested reboot into a power on to avoid this
error.

To minimize the chance of a race condition, it is critical to do this
check immediately before sending the power state change command.  This
keeps the window during which the server could change power states
without us knowing about it as small as possible.

Note that this error is returned in other scenarios as well.

Conflicts:
      ironic/drivers/modules/drac/power.py

Change-Id: I4c95959090423ff1929700f0fce596510447ac1c
Story: 2007487
Task: 39206
(cherry picked from commit 95a3e1bdfd12b8b579c0dd6ff8e12d80d4214117)

commit_message:
Add py38 package metadata

Now that we are running the Victoria tests that include a
voting py38, we can now add the Python 3.8 metadata to the
package information to reflect that support.

Change-Id: I449ba49cd8c2c8c9890b603c298295c56a5df6de
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Deploy step logging would previously only log the step to the API
user, instead of anything the API user could use to try and determine

commit_message:
Make deploy step failure logging indicate the error

Deploy step logging would previously only log the step to the API
user, instead of anything the API user could use to try and determine
what is wrong.

Example:
- Trying to power on a machine as part of deploy.deploy()
- Power-on operation fails
- Only the deploy step is listed as the error, and no
  additional information to troubleshoot the issue,
  which forced the operator to go examine logs and
  find the error.

Change-Id: If60b96dcafa446de090df56089760eda3a21109d
(cherry picked from commit 6a1d453ef0dd9536e500ff8c45846826dca40e8b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-17 11:08:53.000000000', 'message': 'Improve SSH known host error messages

A common failure early on when using Kayobe is during discovery of SSH
known hosts. This happens if a host does not have an IP address
configured on the admin (SSH) network. The failure looks like this:

PLAY [Ensure known hosts are configured]
**********************************************************************
TASK [ssh-known-host : Scan for SSH keys]
**********************************************************************
failed: [compute0 -> localhost] (item=) => {"ansible_loop_var": "item",
    "changed": false, "cmd": ["ssh-keyscan"], "delta": "0:00:00.013855",
    "end": "2020-04-17 10:51:01.857855", "item": "", "msg": "non-zero
        return code", "rc": 1, "start": "2020-04-17 10:51:01.844000",
    "stderr": "usage: ssh-keyscan [-46cDHv] [-f file] [-p port] [-T
        timeout] [-t type]\n\t\t   [host | addrlist namelist]",
    "stderr_lines": ["u sage: ssh-keyscan [-46cDHv] [-f file] [-p port]
        [-T timeout] [-t type]", "\t\t   [host | addrlist namelist]"],
        "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": []}

This happens when ansible_host is an empty string, typically because the
host has no IP address defined in for the admin network in
network-allocation.yml. This is very confusing for a new user. We should
provide a more informative message.

It's not exactly how a user gets to this point, since the
ip-allocation.yml playbook runs before ssh-known-host.yml, which should
populate network-allocation.yml.

This change detects this failure mode and provides a message with
information about how to resolve it.

Change-Id: I564b6e4509a30dec7c49a23bb2f75d490be775ed
Story: 2007566
Task: 39456

commit_message:
Improve SSH known host error messages

A common failure early on when using Kayobe is during discovery of SSH
known hosts. This happens if a host does not have an IP address
configured on the admin (SSH) network. The failure looks like this:

PLAY [Ensure known hosts are configured]
**********************************************************************
TASK [ssh-known-host : Scan for SSH keys]
**********************************************************************
failed: [compute0 -> localhost] (item=) => {"ansible_loop_var": "item",
    "changed": false, "cmd": ["ssh-keyscan"], "delta": "0:00:00.013855",
    "end": "2020-04-17 10:51:01.857855", "item": "", "msg": "non-zero
        return code", "rc": 1, "start": "2020-04-17 10:51:01.844000",
    "stderr": "usage: ssh-keyscan [-46cDHv] [-f file] [-p port] [-T
        timeout] [-t type]\n\t\t   [host | addrlist namelist]",
    "stderr_lines": ["u sage: ssh-keyscan [-46cDHv] [-f file] [-p port]
        [-T timeout] [-t type]", "\t\t   [host | addrlist namelist]"],
        "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": []}

This happens when ansible_host is an empty string, typically because the
host has no IP address defined in for the admin network in
network-allocation.yml. This is very confusing for a new user. We should
provide a more informative message.

It's not exactly clear how a user gets to this point, since the
ip-allocation.yml playbook runs before ssh-known-host.yml, which should
populate network-allocation.yml.

This change detects this failure mode and provides a message with
information about how to resolve it.

Change-Id: I564b6e4509a30dec7c49a23bb2f75d490be775ed
Story: 2007566
Task: 39456

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-20 15:06:58.000000000', 'message': 'Remove nameservers with any IP in overcloud resolv.conf workaround

Kayobe has a workaround for CentOS cloud images which contain a bogus
nameserver entry in /etc/resolv.conf. By setting
overcloud_host_image_workaround_resolv_enabled to true, the entry would
be removed. Previously we removed a specific IP address - 10.0.2.3 -
that was present in the CentOS 7 images. However, it seems that CentOS 8
images have a different IP - 192.168.122.1.

This change fixes the issue and becomes resilient to future changes by
matching any IP address. This should be fairly safe, since this
workaround is opt-in.

Change-Id: I9323a38cb2bb627ff56f5713900be00595ea8d4b
Story: 2006574
Task: 39484
'}]
commit_message:
Remove nameservers with any IP in overcloud resolv.conf workaround

Kayobe has a workaround for CentOS cloud images which contain a bogus
nameserver entry in /etc/resolv.conf. By setting
overcloud_host_image_workaround_resolv_enabled to true, the entry would
be removed. Previously we removed a specific IP address - 10.0.2.3 -
that was present in the CentOS 7 images. However, it seems that CentOS 8
images have a different IP - 192.168.122.1.

This change fixes the issue and becomes resilient to future changes by
matching any IP address. This should be fairly safe, since this
workaround is opt-in.

Change-Id: I9323a38cb2bb627ff56f5713900be00595ea8d4b
Story: 2006574
Task: 39484

[{'created': '2020-04-22 10:08:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issue where server fails to reboot

The iDRAC will return a "The command failed to set RequestedState" error
if the server is powered off and a reboot is requested.  In this
situation, convert the requested reboot into a power on to avoid this
error.

To minimize the chance of a race condition, it is critical to do this
check immediately before sending the power state change command.  This
keeps the window during which the server could change power states
without us knowing about it as small as possible.

Note that this error is returned in other scenarios as well.

Conflicts:
      ironic/drivers/modules/drac/power.py

Change-Id: I4c95959090423ff1929700f0fce596510447ac1c
Story: 2007487
Task: 39206
(cherry picked from commit 95a3e1bdfd12b8b579c0dd6ff8e12d80d4214117)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issue where server fails to reboot

The iDRAC will return a "The command failed to set RequestedState" error
if the server is powered off and a reboot is requested.  In this
situation, convert the requested reboot into a power on to avoid this
error.

To minimize the chance of a race condition, it is critical to do this
check immediately before sending the power state change command.  This
keeps the window during which the server could change power states
without us knowing about it as small as possible.

Note that this error is returned in other scenarios as well.

Conflicts:
      ironic/drivers/modules/drac/power.py

Change-Id: I4c95959090423ff1929700f0fce596510447ac1c
Story: 2007487
Task: 39206
(cherry picked from commit 95a3e1bdfd12b8b579c0dd6ff8e12d80d4214117)

commit_message:
Fix Designate not to use etcd coordination backend

etcd via tooz does not support group membership required by
Designate coordination.
The best k-a can do is not to configure etcd in Designate.

Change-Id: I2f64f928e730355142ac369d8868cf9f65ca357e
Closes-bug: #1872205
Related-bug: #1840070
(cherry picked from commit 3c234603a9c8e443dc3d38989e3e78147757d1da)

'}]
commit_message:
Remove octavia user from admin project

It is unnecessary to add octavia user into admin project.
Octavia project does not require this action. Like other projects,
octavia user in service project with admin role is enough.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/octavia/latest/install/install-ubuntu.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/octavia/latest/contributor/guides/dev-quick-start.html#production-deployment-walkthrough
[3] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/devstack/plugin.sh

Closes-Bug: #1873176
Change-Id: I35d35177aaabfc6f0abc533a1f756b363bd02308
(cherry picked from commit bb7e1e86601d46d1d12620ec44993c493bb923fe)

commit_message:
Fix Designate not to use etcd coordination backend

etcd via tooz does not support group membership required by
Designate coordination.
The best k-a can do is not to configure etcd in Designate.

Change-Id: I2f64f928e730355142ac369d8868cf9f65ca357e
Closes-bug: #1872205
Related-bug: #1840070
(cherry picked from commit 3c234603a9c8e443dc3d38989e3e78147757d1da)

commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Ida22dd3800f4c18f4fb05040d4d7d6ace3e7dee4
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 06:46:17.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Image auto signature

Image auto signature means each image Nova put via Glance API
will have appropriate image properties needed for image signature
validation.

The following configuration required to enable image auto signature
from nova.

[glance]
enable_image_auto_signature = True
verify_glance_signatures = True
enable_certificate_validation = True

[key_manager]
image_auto_signature_certificate_uuid = a43dfba0-801e-4f8a-b168-b299cc89b0fc
image_auto_signature_key_uuid = e441f873-66e3-4ba6-8067-cd7e47cdfa62
image_auto_signature_hash_method = SHA-512
image_auto_signature_key_type = RSA-PSS

Most convenient method to provide trusted certificate id is via nova
cli, see also nova/doc/source/user/certificate-validation.rst.

cert_uuid = dd1f7986-8f17-4461-9872-b3bcc19ac1a7
nova boot vm1 --image cirros-0.4.0-x86_64-disk --flavor c1 --nic net-name=public --trusted-image-certificate-id $cert_uuid

Closes-Bug: #1875287
Change-Id: Iaa8c39704616a0728094486b000e63ca93c5709a
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Image auto signature

Image auto signature means each image Nova put via Glance API
will have appropriate image properties needed for image signature
validation.

The following configuration required to enable image auto signature
from nova.

[glance]
enable_image_auto_signature = True
verify_glance_signatures = True
enable_certificate_validation = True

[key_manager]
image_auto_signature_certificate_uuid = a43dfba0-801e-4f8a-b168-b299cc89b0fc
image_auto_signature_key_uuid = e441f873-66e3-4ba6-8067-cd7e47cdfa62
image_auto_signature_hash_method = SHA-512
image_auto_signature_key_type = RSA-PSS

Most convenient method to provide trusted certificate id is via nova
cli, see also nova/doc/source/user/certificate-validation.rst.

cert_uuid = dd1f7986-8f17-4461-9872-b3bcc19ac1a7
nova boot vm1 --image cirros-0.4.0-x86_64-disk --flavor c1 --nic net-name=public --trusted-image-certificate-id $cert_uuid

Closes-Bug: #1875287
Change-Id: Iaa8c39704616a0728094486b000e63ca93c5709a

Hi. what is the good way to solve bug? Could you command?'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-27 07:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi, based on bug report and comment above the fix, I guess the claim that stdin was parsed as utf-8 was false. I would advise that you check locally if you use a UTF-8 locale. If not, then we could think about smoothing out the experience for non-UTF-8 locales; if yes, then we might have to check where that surrogate happens as it should not.'}, {'account_id': 22290, 'date': '2020-04-27 10:31:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > yes, then we might have to check where that surrogate happens as it
 > should not.

Ok.I will check it again Thanks'}]

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Use newer openstackdocstheme and Sphinx versions
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine

Change-Id: Ic96b71596d4523e55fa4b451c99a8521dd581e4d

commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Ia2304240ac09a756249b5689e7fff9c829c7bc9a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix the amphora noop driver

The amphora no-op driver did not get updated properly for the multi-amphora
failover fix.
This patch fixes that issue and corrects the doc strings for the
haproxy amphora driver update_amphora_listeners method.

Change-Id: Ib0d63da7c5599069f5ea50f0dfbc59eefba58c84

commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I0b7dada243ff409437c1799cd2b88696379f1a54
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
